body: I completely uninstalled Node, then reinstalled just the 32bit version (via Node installer). Still hitting the error... it's like something is forcing my environment to use a 64bit build, but I don't know what.

I just rebased by branch (previously off 0.25.2 tag) to the latest (0.26.0) and here is the most recent error / stack trace from running `build.py`:

```

lib /DLL /OUT:node.dll @node.dll.rsp" 2 mt.exe rc.exe "obj\vendor\node\node.node.dll.intermediate.ma

node.dll : fatal error LNK1169: one or more multiply defined symbols found
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "gyp-win-tool", line 316, in <module>
    sys.exit(main(sys.argv[1:]))
  File "gyp-win-tool", line 29, in main
    exit_code = executor.Dispatch(args)
  File "gyp-win-tool", line 71, in Dispatch
    return getattr(self, method)(*args[1:])
  File "gyp-win-tool", line 169, in ExecLinkWithManifests
    subprocess.check_call(ldcmd + add_to_ld)
  File "c:\Python27\lib\subprocess.py", line 540, in check_call
    raise CalledProcessError(retcode, cmd)
subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command 'c:\Python27\python.exe gyp-win-tool link-wrapper environment
.x64 False link.exe /nologo /IMPLIB:node.dll.lib /DLL /OUT:node.dll @node.dll.rsp node.dll.manifest.
res' returned non-zero exit status 1169
ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.
```

After deleting my local directory, re-cloning from GitHub, and clean/bootstrap/build things magically work again for a 32bit build.

I did notice that the default `--target_arch` is `ia32` so I'm wondering if something got cached when I originally set that to `x64` (or if x64 was simply the wrong target architecture for my WIndows 8.1 machine). In any case, I'll close this ticket as I am no longer bothered by the original problem.
